newsitem.title: USA: Best Buy sees Q3 below year-ago $0.41/shr.
newsitem.headline: Best Buy sees Q3 below year-ago $0.41/shr.

text.p: Best Buy Co Inc said it expects third-quarter profits to be "significantly below" the year-ago level of $0.41 per share.

"We have made progress with the strategic initiatives underway to improve our gross profit margin, however, the improvement to date will not be sufficient to offset the impact of the sales volume shortfall now projected for the third quarter," said chief executive Richard Schulze.
"As a result, earnings per share for the third quarter are now expected to be significantly below the 41 cents per share reported in last year's third quarter," he said.
Total sales for October were $73.7 million, down from $89.7 million year ago, the retailer said.

Year-to-date same store sales were $739.5 million for the 39 weeks ended November 2, down from $763.0 million a year ago, while total store sales were $782.1 million, down from $973.9 million a year ago, the company said.

Apparel sales rose 0.8 percent on a same store basis in October, while footwear was up 2.3 percent, the company said. Year-to-date apparel fell 1.5 percent on a same-store basis, while footwear fell 6.1 percent.
